title: Enforces ArrayList instead of Vector for performance
description: ArrayList is a much better Collection implementation than Vector if thread-safe operation is not required.

title: Enforces charAt(0) over startsWith
description: (string).startsWith although it adds some sintactic sugar to our code, performance wise (string).charAt(0) is a better approach

title: Enforces StringBuilder over '+=' operator
description: The use of the '+=' operator for appending strings causes the JVM to create and use an internal StringBuffer.

description: The java.util.Arrays class has a 'asList' method that should be used when you want to create a new List from an array of objects.

title: Enforce user of System.arraycopy instead of manual copy
description: Instead of manually copying data between two arrays, use the efficient System.arraycopy method instead.

title: Enforces the use of static conversion instead of intermediate objects to convert
description: Most wrapper classes provide static conversion methods that avoid the need to create intermediate objects just to create the primitive forms.

description: The conversion of literals to strings by concatenating them with empty strings is inefficient.

description: Java will initialize fields with known default values so any explicit initialization of those same defaults is redundant.

description: Assigning a 'null' to a variable (outside of its declaration) is usually bad form.

title: Prohibits the use of octal escape sequence inside a String literal
description: A suspicious octal escape sequence was found inside a String literal. An octal escape sequence inside a literal String shall consist of a backslash followed by OctalDigit | OctalDigit OctalDigit | ZeroToThree OctalDigit OctalDigit

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

title: Enforces calling super inside a constructor
description: It is a good practice to call super() in a constructor. If super() is not called but another constructor (such as an overloaded constructor) is called, this rule will not report it.

title: Enforces constants as static final
description: If a final field is assigned to a compile-time constant, enforces it to be static

title: Enforces that resources are closed
description: Enforces that resources (like Connection, Statement, and ResultSet objects) are always closed after use.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Prohibits non-static initializer block
description: Prohibits the usage of a non-static initializer block.

title: Enforces default label to be last on switch
description: Enforces the default label to be the last label in a switch statement.

title: Prohibits non-case label in a switch
description: Prohibits a non-case label (e.g. a named break/continue label) within a switch statement.

title: Enforces good usage of toArray()
description: Calls to a collection's toArray() method must specify target arrays sized to match the size of the collection.

title: Avoid comparisons with Double.NaN
description: Prohibits equality comparisons with Double.NaN due to the lack of representation precision.

title: Prohibits testing for null with equals
description: Prohibits testing for null ussing the equals() method.

title: Prohibits negation within an if-else
description: Prohibits negation within an 'if' expression with an 'else' clause.

parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: ignoreElseIf
parameters.description: Ignore conditions with an else-if case

title: Prohibits instantiating object to call getClass
description: Prohibits instantiating an object just to call getClass() on it

title: Prohibits idempotent operations
description: Prohibits operations which have no effects

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Prohibits SimpleDateFormat without Locale
description: Prohibits creating a SimpleDateFormat instances without specifying the Locale

title: Enforces never changed fields to be final
description: Enforces private fields whose values never change to be final.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Prohibits toLower/UpperCase without Locale
description: Prohibits String.toLowerCase()/toUpperCase() conversions without Locale.

title: Prohibits protected fields in final class
description: Prohibits the usage of protected fields in final classes

title: Enforces good dataflow
description: The dataflow analysis tracks local definitions, undefinitions and references to variables on different paths on the data flow.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

parameters.name: maxViolations
parameters.description: Maximum number of anomalies per class

parameters.name: maxPaths
parameters.description: maximum number of checked paths per method. A lower value will increase the performance of the rule but may decrease anomalies found

title: Prohibits the use of final local variables
description: Avoid using final local variables, turn them into fields.

title: Prohibits the usage of the 'short' type
description: Java uses the 'short' type to reduce memory usage, not to optimize calculation.

title: Prohibits the use of Volatile keyword
description: Use of the keyword 'volatile' is generally used to fine tune a Java application, and therefore, requires a good expertise of the Java Memory Model. Moreover, its range of action is somewhat misknown.

title: Prohibits the use of Calling GarbageCollector within the code
description: Calls to System.gc(), Runtime.getRuntime().gc(), and System.runFinalization() are not advised.

title: Enforces the declaration of one variable per line
description: Java allows the use of several variables declaration of the same type on one line. However, it can lead to quite messy code. This rule looks for several declarations on the same line.

parameters.name: strictMode
parameters.description: If true, mark combined declaration even if the declarations are on seperate lines.

title: Enforces good naming of variables
description: Prefixing parameters by 'in' or 'out' pollutes the name of the parameters and reduces code readability. To indicate whether or not a parameter will be modify in a method, its better to document method behavior with Javadoc.

title: Prohibits the use of literals in If Else statements
description: Avoid using hard-coded literals in conditional statements. By declaring them as static variables or private members with descriptive names maintainability is enhanced.

parameters.name: ignoreMagicNumbers
parameters.description: Comma-Separated list of magic numbers, that should be ignored

title: Enforces the declaration of Objects for cleaner API
description: When you write a public method, you should be thinking in terms of an API. If your method is public, it means other class will use it, therefore, you want (or need) to offer a comprehensive and evolutive API.

title: Enforces the use of explicit scoping
description: Use explicit scoping instead of the default package private level.

title: Prohibits the use of JNI(Java Native Interface)
description: Unnecessary reliance on Java Native Interface (JNI) calls directly reduces application portability and increases the maintenance burden.

title: Prohibits the alteration of a variable accessibility
description: Methods such as getDeclaredConstructors(), getDeclaredConstructor(Class[]) and setAccessible(), as the interface PrivilegedAction, allows for the runtime alteration of variable, class, or method visibility, even if they are private.

title: Prohibits Empty Catch Blocks
description: Empty Catch Block finds instances where an exception is caught, but nothing is done. In most circumstances, this swallows an exception which should either be acted on or reported.

parameters.name: allowCommentedBlocks
parameters.description: Empty blocks containing comments will be skipped

title: Prohibits empty If Statements
description: Empty If Statement finds instances where a condition is checked but nothing is done about it.

title: Prohibits the use of an empty While statement
description: Empty While Statement finds all instances where a while statement does nothing. If it is a timing loop, then you should use Thread.sleep() for it; if it is a while loop that does a lot in the exit expression, rewrite it to make it clearer.

title: Prohibits unsafe static field
description: Prohibits the usage of a possible unsafe static field.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Prohibits useless class
description: Prohibits a class that has private constructors and does not have any static methods or fields.

title: Prohibits method-level synchronization
description: Prohibits the usage of method-level synchronized modifier.

title: Prohibits switch statements without break
description: Prohibits switch statements without break or return statements for each case option.

title: Prohibits thread.notify()
description: Prohibits the usage of Thread.notify(), use Thread.notifyAll() instead.

title: Prohibits instanceof in catch block
description: Prohibits the usage of instanceof in a catch block.

title: Prohibits abstract class without abstract methods
description: Prohibits abstract classes that does not contain any abstract methods.

title: Avoid check for null before instanceof
description: Prohibits check for null before an instanceof

title: Enforce equals() to compare objects
description: Enforce the usage of equals() to compare objects instead of ==

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Enforces literals first in comparisons
description: Enforces literals to be positioned first in comparisons

title: Prohibits non-thread safe singletons
description: Prohibits usage of non-thread safe singletons. It can result in bad state changes.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

parameters.name: checkNonStaticFields
parameters.description: Check for non-static fields. Do not set this to true and checkNonStaticMethods to false

parameters.name: checkNonStaticMethods
parameters.description: Check for non-static methods. Do not set this to false and checkNonStaticFields to true.

title: Prohibits uncommented empty methods
description: Prohibits the declaration of uncommented empty method body.

title: Prohibits uncommented empty constructors
description: Prohibits the declaration of uncommented empty constructor body.

parameters.name: ignoreExplicitConstructorInvocation
parameters.description: Ignore explicit constructor invocation when deciding whether constructor is empty or not

title: Prohibits interface as constants container
description: Prohibits the declaration of an interface as a container of constants

title: Enforces SimpleDateFormat to be synchronized
description: Enforces SimpleDateFormat instances to be synchronized

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Enforces statckTrace preservation
description: Enfroces stackTrace preservation when throwing exceptions on catch blocks.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Enforces isEmpty() to determine if collection has elements.
description: Enforces isEmpty() method to determine if a collection has any elements.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Enforces final on class with only private constructors
description: Enforces a class with only private constructors to be final, unless the private constructor is invoked by a inner class.

title: Prohibits empty non-abstract methods in abstract class
description: Prohibits the definition of empty non-abstract methods in an abstract class.

title: Prohibits fields when local variable is enough
description: Prohibits the use of fields whose scopes are limited to just single methods, declare them as local variables instead.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

parameters.name: disallowNotAssignment
parameters.description: Disallow violations where the first usage is not an assignment

parameters.name: checkInnerClasses
parameters.description: Check inner classes

title: Prohibits returning null array
description: Prohibits returning null for any method that returns an array.

title: Prohibits abstract class without methods
description: Prohibits an abstract class which does not provides any methods.

title: Prohibits small switch statements
description: Prohibits switch statements for only a few cases. Use if-then instead.

parameters.name: minimumNumberCaseForASwitch
parameters.description: Minimum number of branches for a switch

title: Enforces opposite operator instead of negating
description: Enforces the usage of the opposite operator instead of negating the whole expression with a logic complement operator.

title: Enforces varargs for arbitrary number of parameters
description: Enforces the use of varargs instead of arrays when declaring a method with arbitrary number os parameters.

title: Enforces field declarations at top of the class
description: Enforces field declarations at the top of the class, before any method declarations, constructors, initializers or inner classes.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

parameters.name: ignoreAnonymousClassDeclarations
parameters.description: Ignore Field Declarations, that are initialized with anonymous class declarations

parameters.name: ignoreEnumDeclarations
parameters.description: Ignore Enum Declarations that precede fields.

title: Prohibits protected methods in final classes
description: Prohibits the definition of protected methods in final classes.

title: Prohibits empty try blocks
description: Avoid empty try blocks - what's the point?

title: Prohibits empty finally blocks
description: Empty finally blocks serve no purpose and should be removed.

title: Prohibits the use of empty switch statements
description: Empty switch statements serve no purpose and should be removed.

title: Prohibits the use of empty synchronized blocks
description: Empty synchronized blocks serve no purpose and should be removed.

title: Prohibits empty statements that are not inside a loop
description: An empty statement (or a semicolon by itself) that is not used as the sole body of a 'for' or 'while' loop is probably a bug. It could also be a double semicolon, which has no purpose and should be removed.

title: Prohibits the use of empty initializers
description: Empty initializers serve no purpose and should be removed.

title: Prohibits the implementation of empty block statements
description: Empty block statements serve no purpose and should be removed.

title: Prohibits the use of an empty static initializer
description: An empty static initializer serve no purpose and should be removed.

title: Prohibits the use of temporary objects for conversions to String
description: Avoid the use temporary objects when converting primitives to Strings. Use the static conversion methods on the wrapper classes instead.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Prohibits the use of unnecessary return statements
description: Avoid the use of unnecessary return statements.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Prohibits the use of final tag when class has the final modifier
description: When a class has the final modifier, all the methods are automatically final and do not need to be tagged as such.

title: Prohibits the use of the overriding method
description: The overriding method merely calls the same method defined in a superclass.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

parameters.name: ignoreAnnotations
parameters.description: Ignore annotations

title: Prohibits an operation on an Immutable object that tries to change the object itself
description: An operation on an Immutable object (String, BigDecimal or BigInteger) won't change the object itself since the result of the operation is a new object. Therefore, ignoring the operation result is an error.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Enforces the correct usage of null checking in object references
description: After checking an object reference for null, you should invoke equals() on that object rather than passing it to another object's equals() method.

title: Prohibits the use of useless parentheses
description: Useless parentheses should be removed.

title: Enforces the call to super when implementing clone()
description: Object clone() should be implemented with super.clone().

title: Enforces throwing a CloneNotSupportedException when using clone()
description: The method clone() should throw a CloneNotSupportedException.

title: Prohibits the implementation of an empty Finalizer
description: Empty finalize methods serve no purpose and should be removed.

title: Prohibits only calling super.finalize() inside finalize()
description: If the finalize() is implemented, it should do something besides just calling super.finalize().

title: Enforces finalize to not have any parameters
description: Methods named finalize() should not have parameters. It is confusing and most likely an attempt to overload Object.finalize(). It will not be called by the VM.

title: Enforces the call of super.finalize as the last action in finalize
description: If the finalize() is implemented, its last action should be to call super.finalize.

title: Enforces the finalize method to be protected
description: When overriding the finalize(), the new method should be set as protected. If made public, other classes may invoke it at inappropriate times.

title: Prohibits the calling of Object.finalize() method
description: The method Object.finalize() is called by the garbage collector on an object when garbage collection determines that there are no more references to the object. It should not be invoked by application logic.

title: Enforces that the code should be separeted by modular methods
description: The NPath complexity of a method is the number of acyclic execution paths through that method. A threshold of 200 is generally considered the point where measures should be taken to reduce complexity and increase readability.

description: When methods are excessively long this usually indicates that the method is doing more than its name/signature might suggest.

description: Methods with numerous parameters are a challenge to maintain, especially if most of them share the same datatype.

description: Excessive class file lengths are usually indications that the class may be burdened with excessive responsibilities that could be provided by external classes or functions.

title: Enforces the division of a many public methods class into seperate ones
description: Classes with large numbers of public methods and attributes require disproportionate testing efforts since combinational side effects grow rapidly and increase risk.

description: Classes that have too many fields can become unwieldy and could be redesigned to have fewer fields, possibly through grouping related fields in new objects.

title: Enforces refactoring of Class if there are too many methods
description: A class with too many methods is probably a good suspect for refactoring, in order to reduce its complexity and find a way to have more fine grained objects.

title: Prohibits useless if statements
description: Prohibits the usage of if statements whose conditionals are always true or always false.

title: Prohibits instantiation of Boolean
description: Prohibits instantiation of Boolean objects, you can reference Boolean.TRUE, Boolean.FALSE

title: Prohibits multiple if statements that can combine
description: Prohibits the usage of two consecutive if statements that can be consolidated by separating their conditions with a boolean short-circuit operator.

title: Prohibits cast to Array without parameter
description: Prohibits casting an array without providing an array of the same class as the parameter of the toArray() method.

title: Prohibits misplaced null check
description: Prohibits a null check that is done only after the usage of the reference

title: Prohibits the usage of ThreadGroup
description: Prohibits the usage of java.lang.ThreadGroup.

title: Prohibits creation of already existing BigInteger
description: Prohibits the creation of already existing BigInteger (BigInteger.ZERO, BigInteger.ONE ..)

title: Prohibits explicitly extending Object
description: Prohibits the explicit extends of Object.

title: Super should be called at the start of the method
description: Super should be called at the start of the method

title: Super should be called at the end of the method
description: Super should be called at the end of the method

title: Use Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory() instead of '/sdcard'
description: Use Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory() instead of '/sdcard'

title: Avoid importing anything from the package 'java.lang'.
description: Avoid importing anything from the package 'java.lang'. These classes are automatically imported (JLS 7.5.3).

title: Avoid unused import statements.

title: There is no need to import a type that lives in the same package.

title: Avoid many static imports.
description: If you overuse the static import feature, it can make your program unreadable and unmaintainable, polluting its namespace with all the static members you import.

parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

title: Import statements allow the use of non-fully qualified names.
description: Import statements allow the use of non-fully qualified names.

title: Avoid the getClassLoader() method in J2EE.
description: In J2EE, the getClassLoader() method might not work as expected. Use Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader() instead.

title: MessageDrivenBean or SessionBean should be suffixed by 'Bean'.
description: The EJB Specification states that any MessageDrivenBean or SessionBean should be suffixed by 'Bean'.

title: Remote Home interface should be suffixed by 'Home'.
description: A Remote Home interface type of a Session EJB should be suffixed by 'Home'.

title: The Local Interface of a Session EJB should be be proper suffixed.
description: The Local Interface of a Session EJB should be suffixed by 'Local'.

title: The Local Home interface should be proper suffixed.
description: The Local Home interface of a Session EJB should be suffixed by 'LocalHome'.

title: Remote Interface of a Session EJB should not have a suffix.
description: Remote Interface of a Session EJB should not have a suffix.

title: Web applications should not call System.exit().
description: Web applications should not call System.exit(), since only the web container or the application server should stop the JVM.

title: An EJB should not have any static fields with write access.
description: According to the J2EE specification, an EJB should not have any static fields with write access. However, static read-only fields are allowed.

title: The J2EE specification explicitly forbids the use of threads.
description: The J2EE specification explicitly forbids the use of threads.

title: Serializable classes should provide a serialVersionUID field.
description: Serializable classes should provide a serialVersionUID field.

title: The suite() method in a JUnit test needs to be both public and static.
description: The suite() method in a JUnit test needs to be both public and static.

title: Some JUnit framework methods are easy to misspell.
description: Some JUnit framework methods are easy to misspell.

title: JUnit assertions should use the three-argument version of assertEquals().
description: JUnit assertions should include an informative message - i.e., use the three-argument version of assertEquals(), not the two-argument version.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: JUnit tests should include at least one assertion.
description: JUnit tests should include at least one assertion. This makes the tests more robust, and using assert with messages provide the developer a clearer idea of what the test does.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Unnecessary JUnit test assertion with a boolean literal.
description: A JUnit test assertion with a boolean literal is unnecessary since it always will evaluate to the same thing.

title: Use assertEquals in assertions when testing object equality.
description: This rule detects JUnit assertions in object equality. These assertions should be made by more specific methods, like assertEquals.

title: Use assertSame/assertNotSame in assertions when testing object references equality.
description: This rule detects JUnit assertions in object references equality. These assertions should be made by more specific methods, like assertSame, assertNotSame.

title: This rule detects JUnit assertions in object references equality. These assertions should be made by more specific methods, like assertNull, assertNotNull.
description: This rule detects JUnit assertions in object references equality. These assertions should be made by more specific methods, like assertNull, assertNotNull.

title: Avoid negation in an assertTrue or assertFalse test.
description: Avoid negation in an assertTrue or assertFalse test. If you are using a negations consider to use the opposite method (assertTrue instead of assertFalse, or assertFalse instead of assertTrue)

title: JUnit tests should not contain too many asserts.
description: JUnit tests should not contain too many asserts. Many asserts are indicative of a complex test, for which it is harder to verify correctness.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Use assertTrue/assertFalse to assert boolean values.
description: When asserting a value is the same as a boolean literal, use assertTrue/assertFalse, instead of assertEquals.

title: Use the logging statement with a String and a Throwable.
description: To make sure the full stacktrace is printed out, use the logging statement with two arguments: a String and a Throwable.

title: A logger should be private static final.
description: A logger should normally be defined private static final and be associated with the correct class.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Guard with a isDebugEnabled() concatenated log messages
description: When log messages are composed by concatenating strings, the whole section should be guarded by a isDebugEnabled() check to avoid performance and memory issues.

parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Check if the log level is actually enabled.
description: Whenever using a log level, one should check if the loglevel is actually enabled, or otherwise skip the associate String creation and manipulation.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Use only one logger in each class.
description: Normally only one logger is used in each class.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: The Logger reference should be declared as static and final.
description: In most cases, the Logger reference can be declared as static and final.

title: Avoid using System.(out|err).print.
description: References to System.(out|err).print are usually intended for debugging purposes and can remain in the codebase even in production code.

title: Avoid printStackTrace().
description: Avoid printStackTrace(); use a logger call instead.

title: Check if the log level is actually enabled.
description: Whenever using a log level, one should check if the loglevel is actually enabled, or otherwise skip the associate String creation and manipulation.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Avoid using Vector.
description: Consider replacing Vector usages with the newer java.util.ArrayList if expensive thread-safe operations are not required.

title: Avoid using Hashtable.
description: Consider replacing Hashtable usage with the newer java.util.Map if thread safety is not required.

title: Avoid using Enumeration.
description: Consider replacing Enumeration usages with the newer java.util.Iterator

title: Enforce Integer.valueOf() instead of new Integer().
description: Calling new Integer() causes memory allocation that can be avoided by the static Integer.valueOf(). It makes use of an internal cache that recycles earlier instances making it more memory efficient.

title: Enforce Byte.valueOf() instead of new Byte().
description: Calling new Byte() causes memory allocation that can be avoided by the static Byte.valueOf(). It makes use of an internal cache that recycles earlier instances making it more memory efficient.

title: Enforce Short.valueOf() instead of new Short().
description: Calling new Short() causes memory allocation that can be avoided by the static Short.valueOf(). It makes use of an internal cache that recycles earlier instances making it more memory efficient.

title: Enforce Long.valueOf() instead of new Long().
description: Calling new Long() causes memory allocation that can be avoided by the static Long.valueOf(). It makes use of an internal cache that recycles earlier instances making it more memory efficient.

title: Use proper setUp declaration in JUnit 3 and JUnit 4 In JUnit 3.
description: In JUnit 3, the setUp method was used to set up all data entities required in running tests. JUnit 4 skips the setUp method and executes all methods annotated with @Before before all tests

title: Use proper tear down declaration in JUnit 3 and JUnit 4 In JUnit 3.
description: In JUnit 3, the tearDown method was used to clean up all data entities required in running tests. JUnit 4 skips the tearDown method and executes all methods annotated with @After after running each test

title: Use proper test declaration in JUnit 3 and JUnit 4 In JUnit 3.
description: In JUnit 3, the framework executed all methods which started with the word test as a unit test. In JUnit 4, only methods annotated with the @Test annotation are executed.

title: Use proper test suite declaration in JUnit 3 and JUnit 4 In JUnit 3.
description: In JUnit 3, test suites are indicated by the suite() method. In JUnit 4, suites are indicated through the @RunWith(Suite.class) annotation.

title: Use proper throwing exceptions tests declaration in JUnit 3 and JUnit 4 In JUnit 3.
description: In JUnit4, use the @Test(expected) annotation to denote tests that should throw exceptions.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Avoid catching Throwable errors.
description: Catching Throwable errors is not recommended since its scope is very broad. It includes runtime issues such as OutOfMemoryError that should be exposed and managed separately.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Avoid methods declaring to throw the generic Exception.
description: Methods that declare the generic Exception as a possible throwable are not very helpful since their failure modes are unclear.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Avoid using Exceptions as form of flow control.
description: Using Exceptions as form of flow control is not recommended as they obscure true exceptions when debugging. Either add the necessary validation or use an alternate control structure.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Prohibit throw NullPointerExceptions.
description: Code should never throw NullPointerExceptions under normal circumstances. A catch block may hide the original error, causing other, more subtle problems later on.

title: Avoid throwing general exception types.
description: Avoid throwing certain exception types. Rather than throw a raw RuntimeException, Throwable, Exception, or Error, use a subclassed exception or error instead.

title: Avoid throwing NullPointerExceptions.
description: Avoid throwing NullPointerExceptions. These are confusing because most people will assume that the virtual machine threw it.

title: Avoid catch blocks that merely rethrow a caught exception.
description: Catch blocks that merely rethrow a caught exception only add to code size and runtime complexity.

title: Errors are system exceptions. Do not extend them.
description: Errors are system exceptions. Do not extend them.

title: Throwing exceptions within a 'finally' block is confusing since they may mask other exceptions or code defects.
description: Throwing exceptions within a 'finally' block is confusing since they may mask other exceptions or code defects.

title: Avoid catch blocks that merely rethrow a caught exception wrapped.
description: Catch blocks that merely rethrow a caught exception wrapped inside a new instance of the same type only add to code size and runtime complexity.

title: Avoid catching generic exceptions
description: Avoid catching generic exceptions such as NullPointerException, RuntimeException, Exception in try-catch block

title: Avoid invoke accessors on the exception without using the information in a catch block.
description: Statements in a catch block that invoke accessors on the exception without using the information only add to code size. Either remove the invocation, or use the return result.

title: Avoid code containing duplicate String literals.
description: Code containing duplicate String literals can usually be improved by declaring the String as a constant field.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression

title: Avoid instantiating String objects.
description: Avoid instantiating String objects; this is usually unnecessary since they are immutable and can be safely shared.

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath

title: Don't call toString() on string instances.
description: Avoid calling toString() on objects already known to be string instances; this is unnecessary.

title: Avoid concatenating non-literals in a StringBuffer constructor or append.
description: Avoid concatenating non-literals in a StringBuffer constructor or append() since intermediate buffers will need to be be created and destroyed by the JVM.

title: Using equalsIgnoreCase() instead of toUpperCase/toLowerCase().equals()
description: Using equalsIgnoreCase() is faster than using toUpperCase/toLowerCase().equals()

title: Use StringBuffer.length() to determine StringBuffer length
description: Use StringBuffer.length() to determine StringBuffer length rather than using StringBuffer.toString().equals("") or StringBuffer.toString().length() == ...

parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

title: Avoid concatenating characters as strings in append methods.
description: Avoid concatenating characters as strings in StringBuffer/StringBuilder.append methods.

description: Consecutively calls to StringBuffer/StringBuilder .append should reuse the target object. This can improve the performance.

title: Use String.indexOf(char) when checking for the index of a single character.
description: Use String.indexOf(char) when checking for the index of a single character; it executes faster.

title: String.trim().length() is an inefficient way to check if a String is empty.
description: String.trim().length() is an inefficient way to check if a String is really empty, as it creates a new String object just to check its size.

title: Enforce pre-size a StringBuffer or StringBuilder properly.
description: Failing to pre-size a StringBuffer or StringBuilder properly could cause it to re-size many times during runtime.

title: Avoid to call String.valueOf to append to a string.
description: No need to call String.valueOf to append to a string; just use the valueOf() argument directly.

title: Individual character values provided as initialization arguments will be converted into integers.
description: Individual character values provided as initialization arguments will be converted into integers. This can lead to internal buffer sizes that are larger than expected. Some examples:

title: Avoid using '==' or '!=' to compare strings.
description: Using  '==' or '!=' to compare strings only works if intern version is used on both sides. Use the equals() method instead.

title: StringBuffers/StringBuilders can grow considerably, and so may become a source of memory leaks
description: StringBuffers/StringBuilders can grow considerably, and so may become a source of memory leaks if held within objects with long lifetimes.

title: Enforces the class to implement Cloneable interface when using clone()
description: The method clone() should only be implemented if the class implements the Cloneable interface with the exception of a final method that only throws CloneNotSupportedException.

parameters.name: violationSuppressRegex
parameters.description: Suppress violations with messages matching a regular expression

parameters.name: violationSuppressXPath
parameters.description: Suppress violations on nodes which match a given relative XPath expression
